importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, marking the day Ange Postecoglou was fired from Nottingham Forest, highlighting a pivotal moment in the club's managerial history.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 39-day tenure of Ange Postecoglou is the shortest in Premier League history, making this timeframe significant in the context of managerial turnover and performance benchmarks.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed after just 39 days as manager of Nottingham Forest, following a 3-0 loss to Chelsea.
Postecoglou failed to win any of his matches, drawing two and losing six during his tenure.
The dismissal is the fastest in Premier League history, outpacing Les Reed’s 40-day tenure at Charlton Athletic in 2006.
Sam Allardyce is the only permanent manager in the league’s history to have had a shorter tenure than Postecoglou.
Postecoglou replaced Nuno Espírito Santo, who led the club to its best league finish in 30 years (7th place in 2024/25).
Espírito Santo's departure was linked to a reported change in his relationship with club owner Evangelos Marinakis.
Postecoglou's dismissal followed a period of poor results and fan backlash, including being booed at the final game.
Nottingham Forest is now seeking its third manager of the season due to the rapid turnover.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager, was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days as head coach, following a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea and a winless record of two draws and six losses. This marks the fastest managerial departure in Premier League history, surpassing Les Reed’s 40-day tenure in 2006. Postecoglou replaced Nuno Espírito Santo, whose departure was linked to a strained relationship with club owner Evangelos Marinakis and who had led the club to its highest league finish in 30 years. The club is now searching for its third manager of the season, amid fan backlash and a significant decline in performance.
title: Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou fired after just 39 days at Premier League club
